title: House Republicans are furious about Hunter Biden special counsel
description: Republicans say Weiss' appointment as special counsel investigating criminal charges against Hunter Biden is part of a Justice Department coverup.

title: Nvidia's AI-driven stock surge pushed earnings multiple three times higher than Tesla's
description: Nvidia's graphics chips have proven to be the best for training artificial intelligence models, and clients can't get enough of them.

title: 'Bulletproof' hosting site that allegedly enabled 400 ransomware attacks seized, founder indicted
description: Prosecutors hit Polish national Artur Karol Grabowski with criminal charges over hosting LolekHosted, which allegedly helped criminals deploy ransomware.

title: U.S. judge sends FTX's Sam Bankman-Fried to jail over witness tampering
description: Sam Bankman-Fried heads to jail after a judge sided with a request by federal prosecutors to revoke the FTX founder's bail over alleged witness tampering.

title: Telesat stock surges 50% after satellite internet company swaps suppliers to save $2 billion
description: The company expects to begin launching the first Lightspeed satellites in mid-2026, with global service beginning once the first 156 satellites are in orbit.

title: Aerial photos show total destruction as wildfires ravage historic Lahaina, Hawaii
description: Lahaina has been devastated by the Hawaii wildfires, and at least 55 are dead. The historic city was the capital when the islands were an independent kingdom.

title: Occidental and Climeworks big winners as Biden allocates billions for CO2 removal
description: The U.S. Department of Energy is investing $1.2 billion in giant vacuums that suck carbon out of the air--an effort to slow global warming.

title: The 117-year-old steel maker that's key to solving climate tech's recycling issue
description: Schnitzer Steel is at the center of the circular economy, but its CEO was often asked about its steel, not how its recycling model serves a low-carbon future.

title: Retailers are shaping a wave of laws to crack down on organized theft — here's how they do it
description: Nine states have passed laws addressing organized retail crime and Congress is considering federal action. Experts say the new laws may not reduce crime.

title: U.S. judge will decide Friday whether to send Sam Bankman-Fried to jail over alleged witness tampering
description: A New York judge will decide on Friday, during a hearing that starts at 2 p.m. ET,  whether to send Sam Bankman-Fried to jail.

title: Goldman Sachs-backed digital bank Starling to expand in hotly competitive Asia-Pacific market
description: Starling, which is backed by Goldman Sachs, is in talks with an Asian bank about launching its Engine banking-as-a-service platform in the Asia-Pacific market.

title: Investors are 'overconfident' about the impact of A.I., strategist says
description: Market participants are "overconfident" about their ability to predict the long-term effects of AI on company performance, according to Morningstar's Mike Coop.

title: With eyes on Taiwan, new China ban shows the U.S. may be learning lessons from mistakes with Russia
description: U.S. moves to ban certain investment in China suggest that Western allies may be learning from national security failings in Russia, according to analysts.

title: Chinese tech giant Huawei reports tepid consumer revenue growth for the first half of 2023
description: Huawei on Friday reported 2.2% year-on-year growth in its consumer business revenue for the first half of the year.

title: UK economy posts surprise second-quarter growth as households kept spending
description: The U.K. economy recorded surprise growth in the second quarter as household consumption rose.

title: Country Garden shares hit record low after profit warning as debt fears loom
description: The stock reached an intra-day level of 90 Hong Kong cents after the company warned it is expecting a loss of between $6.24 billion to $7.63 billion for the six months ended June.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Is China a no-go for U.S. investment?
description: President Biden's executive order regulating U.S. technology investment in China is the first time Washington is imposing restrictions on U.S. capital outflows.

title: UBS ends Credit Suisse dependence on Swiss central bank loan
description: UBS' takeover of Credit Suisse was brokered in March, amid talks with the Swiss government, the Swiss National Bank and regulator FINMA.

title: Acquisition of Adani Capital opens access to India's 'underbanked' market, Bain says
description: In July, the Boston-based firm agreed to acquire 90% of Adani Capital and Adani Housing, buying out all of Indian billionaire Gautam Adani's family's stake in the company.

title: What Biden's executive order means for U.S. investors in China
description: The Biden administration's long-awaited executive order on U.S. investments in Chinese companies leaves open plenty of questions on how it will be implemented.

title: Singapore narrows 2023 growth forecast on 'weak' external demand
description: The growth forecast was trimmed to between 0.5% to 1.5%, from an earlier range estimate of 0.5% to 2.5%, the Ministry of Trade and Industry on Friday.

title: $1,850 a day? What it costs to visit the 10 most expensive vacation destinations in the world
description: The Caribbean island of St. Barts is the world's most expensive place to visit, according to a ranking of average travel costs in 100 popular vacation spots.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Chilling effect
description: President Biden's executive order regulating U.S. technology investment in China is the first time Washington is imposing restrictions on U.S. capital outflows.
